CIRCULAR 18/ 2000 
 
 
SUB: CONTROL AND ISSUE OF   PHOTO IDENTITY CARDS 
 
 
It has often been found that photo Identity card (PIC) holders enter airport premises 
while not on duty for performing their private work and some are also found to be indulging 
in undesirable activities.  These are clear cases of its-use of PIC and need, to be curbed taking 
into consideration the security and the passenger facilities aspects.  The following guidelines 
are hereby issued with the above objective for strict implementation by all agencies working 
at the airports: - 
 
 
(i) The authorized signatories of all agencies working at the airports in shift basis 
should designate / an appropriate officer for each shift who will be the custodian 
of PICs of staff. 
 
(ii) 
At the beginning of each shift the custodian will hand over the PICs to the 
staff enabling them for access to their area of work and at the end of each shift 
he will collect the PICs from staff and keep in safe custody. 
 
(iii) 
Handing over / taking over of PICs shall be documented by entries in a 
register. 
 
(iv) 
PICs should not be handed over to persons when they are not on duty. 
 
(v) 
PICs shall be kept in a box under lock. Safe custody of PICs shall be ensured 
to avoid misplacement / loss of PICs in bulk. 
 
(vi) 
PIC committee of the airport will conduct surprise checks of the shift 
custodian of the PICs and will record their observations and a copy thereof be 
sent to BCAS Hqrs., every month. 
 
(vii) 
This arrangements should be brought into operation w.e.f. 01.07.2000 at IGI 
airport, New Delhi to begin with and will be extended to other airports later 
on. 
 
 (P.MOHANAN) 
Officer on Special Duty (I) 
for Commissioner of Security (CA)
